text.text_translated: After she climbed Everest, Gerlinde decided to climb all fourteen of the world's 8,000-metre mountains. To make the challenge more difficult, she climbs without using extra **oxygen**, which is the gas in the air that we need to breathe. This is very dangerous because the low amount of oxygen at the top of high mountains can affect how the brain and body work. As a famous climber, Gerlinde uses her fame to support a charity in Nepal which helps poor children and those who have no parents.
